events.name: Xi Jinping's Statement on Taiwan During Party Congress
events.wd_label: Xi Jinping's Statement on Taiwan During Party Congress
events.wd_description: During the opening of China's 20th Party Congress, President Xi Jinping reiterated China's stance on Taiwan, stating that while China strives for peaceful reunification, it does not renounce the right to use force.
events.description: During the opening of China's 20th Party Congress, President Xi Jinping reiterated China's stance on Taiwan, stating that while China strives for peaceful reunification, it does not renounce the right to use force.

events.name: Xi Jinping's Statement
events.wd_description: President Xi Jinping stated that the resolution of the Taiwan issue is up to the Chinese people, emphasizing that China will strive for peaceful reunification but will not rule out the use of force.
events.description: President Xi Jinping stated that the resolution of the Taiwan issue is up to the Chinese people, emphasizing that China will strive for peaceful reunification but will not rule out the use of force.

events.name: Taiwan's Response
events.wd_description: Taiwan responded by asserting that it would not compromise on its sovereignty, freedom, or democracy, rejecting China's claims over the island.
events.description: Taiwan responded by asserting that it would not compromise on its sovereignty, freedom, or democracy, rejecting China's claims over the island.

events.name: Ongoing Tensions
events.wd_description: Tensions between China and Taiwan, heightened after U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit, continue with military activities in the region, though at a reduced pace.
events.description: Tensions between China and Taiwan, heightened after U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit, continue with military activities in the region, though at a reduced pace.

events.name: Brittney Griner Released in Prisoner Swap with Russian Arms Dealer Viktor Bout
events.wd_label: Brittney Griner Released in Prisoner Swap with Russian Arms Dealer Viktor Bout
events.wd_description: WNBA player Brittney Griner was released as part of a prisoner swap between the US and Russia, involving the exchange of Griner for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.
events.description: WNBA player Brittney Griner was released as part of a prisoner swap between the US and Russia, involving the exchange of Griner for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

events.name: Griner's Detention and Release
events.wd_description: Brittney Griner was detained in Russia in February on drug smuggling charges and sentenced to nine years in prison before being released in a prisoner swap in December.
events.description: Brittney Griner was detained in Russia in February on drug smuggling charges and sentenced to nine years in prison before being released in a prisoner swap in December.

events.name: Viktor Bout's Release
events.wd_description: Viktor Bout, a Russian arms dealer known as the "Merchant of Death," was released from a US prison as part of the prisoner swap, where he was serving a 25-year sentence for serious crimes.
events.description: Viktor Bout, a Russian arms dealer known as the "Merchant of Death," was released from a US prison as part of the prisoner swap, where he was serving a 25-year sentence for serious crimes.

events.name: Diplomatic Tensions and Negotiations
events.wd_description: Griner's detention and subsequent release amid the Ukraine war led to significant diplomatic tensions between the US and Russia, with negotiations continuing despite the broader conflict.
events.description: Griner's detention and subsequent release amid the Ukraine war led to significant diplomatic tensions between the US and Russia, with negotiations continuing despite the broader conflict.

events.name: Study Reveals Impact of Heat on Fetal Health in Gambia
events.wd_label: Study Reveals Impact of Heat on Fetal Health in Gambia
events.wd_description: A study found that rising temperatures in the Gambia led to increased fetal heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta among women working in fields, highlighting the risks of heat stress for pregnant women and their unborn children.
events.description: A study found that rising temperatures in the Gambia led to increased fetal heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta among women working in fields, highlighting the risks of heat stress for pregnant women and their unborn children.

events.name: Study Findings on Fetal Health
events.wd_description: The study observed that as temperatures rose, fetuses of women working in fields in the Gambia exhibited increased heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta, raising concerns about heat stress during pregnancy.
events.description: The study observed that as temperatures rose, fetuses of women working in fields in the Gambia exhibited increased heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta, raising concerns about heat stress during pregnancy.

events.name: Global Heat Exposure Concerns
events.wd_description: The study's findings emphasize the risks posed by extreme heat exposure, which is expected to affect hundreds of millions of people, including pregnant women, even if global temperatures stay below the 1.5°C limit.
events.description: The study's findings emphasize the risks posed by extreme heat exposure, which is expected to affect hundreds of millions of people, including pregnant women, even if global temperatures stay below the 1.5°C limit.

events.name: Potential Explanations for Heat Stress Effects
events.wd_label: Potential Explanations for Heat Stress Effects
events.wd_description: Researchers suggested that heat stress in pregnant women may result from dehydration due to sweating and the diversion of blood and oxygen from the placenta to the skin to cool the body.
events.description: Researchers suggested that heat stress in pregnant women may result from dehydration due to sweating and the diversion of blood and oxygen from the placenta to the skin to cool the body.

events.name: GM's Expansion of North American Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_label: GM's Expansion of North American Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: General Motors plans to expand its North American battery supply chain with roughly 20 deals, aiming to produce 1 million electric vehicles annually by 2025 and narrow the gap with Tesla in EV profitability.
events.description: General Motors plans to expand its North American battery supply chain with roughly 20 deals, aiming to produce 1 million electric vehicles annually by 2025 and narrow the gap with Tesla in EV profitability.

events.name: Battery Supply Chain Expansion
events.wd_description: GM has announced around 20 battery supply chain agreements since May 2021 to support its goal of producing 1 million EVs annually in North America by 2025.
events.description: GM has announced around 20 battery supply chain agreements since May 2021 to support its goal of producing 1 million EVs annually in North America by 2025.

events.name: Ultium LLC Joint Venture
events.wd_description: GM's joint venture with LG Energy Solutions, Ultium LLC, has plans for four North American battery plants to enhance its battery manufacturing network.
events.description: GM's joint venture with LG Energy Solutions, Ultium LLC, has plans for four North American battery plants to enhance its battery manufacturing network.

events.name: Impact of Inflation Reduction Act
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act's EV tax credits and subsidies support domestic EV manufacturing and tie federal tax credits to North American manufacturing and materials sourcing.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act's EV tax credits and subsidies support domestic EV manufacturing and tie federal tax credits to North American manufacturing and materials sourcing.

events.name: Federal Subsidies and Competitive Advantage
events.wd_description: Federal subsidies will help GM and its rivals narrow the cost disadvantage of new North American battery production operations in competition with Chinese battery producers.
events.description: Federal subsidies will help GM and its rivals narrow the cost disadvantage of new North American battery production operations in competition with Chinese battery producers.
